meanings.definition: The position or role of being the leader or authority in a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: In the company, the headship of the CEO is crucial for making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: Her headship of the team was evident in how she guided them towards success.
meanings.sent3: The headship of the school principal ensures that rules are followed and learning is prioritized.
meanings.sent4: As the headship of the family, he steered them through challenges with wisdom and care.
meanings.sent5: The headship of the captain kept the crew united and focused during the storm.

meanings.definition: The act of being in charge or having control over something.
meanings.sent1: Taking headship of the project, she organized the tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent2: His headship of the budget allowed for smart financial decisions to be made.
meanings.sent3: The headship of the cat over the house was clear as it lounged on the best chair.
meanings.sent4: With headship over the garden, she nurtured the plants into a beautiful oasis.
meanings.sent5: The headship of the coach motivated the team to give their best in every game.

meanings.definition: The state of being at the front or top of something.
meanings.sent1: The headship of the line belonged to the eldest student in the school.
meanings.sent2: His headship of the mountain gave him a breathtaking view of the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The headship of the parade was a colorful float filled with dancers and music.
meanings.sent4: She reached the headship of the stairs and paused to catch her breath.
meanings.sent5: The headship of the ship allowed the captain to navigate through rough waters.
